Data

This menu area is about importing data into, and exporting data out of NZGrapher.

Open File

This allows you to open a file from your device. The file must be a csv. Excel files are not supported, you need to save it as a csv before uploading.

Import from Clipboard

This allows you to import data that you have already copied onto the clipboard. It needs to be copied from a table in a Google Sheet or an Excel Spreadsheet. The first time you try to use this function it will ask for access to the clipboard.

You need to press allow in order for this to work. If you press block, you can change the setting by pressing on the padlock icon and changing the toggle to on.

Paste Table (Legacy)

Some devices do not support import from clipboard. If this is the case, you can use the paste table (legacy) mode which allows you to paste in a table that you have copied from elsewhere. Note: this is slower than using the Import from Clipboard, so if you can use that, it is better.

Open Link

This allows you to link to a csv file that is hosted on the internet.

Select and Copy Data Table

entry.title: School Folders
entry.summary: School folders allow teachers to load their own datasets onto NZGrapher and then share a link directly to that dataset to their students so the…
entry.content:
School folders allow teachers to load their own datasets onto NZGrapher and then share a link directly to that dataset to their students so the students don't need to individually load the dataset.

(VIDEO TO COME)

If you would like a folder set up for you school, please contact me.

If you do not want students to be able to download the dataset if you prefix it with SECURE (all in capitals) the download dataset option will be unavailable.

entry.title: NZGrapher Invoice
entry.summary: The form below allows you to create an invoice that you can pass onto your school for the use of NZGrapher. Once you press the…
entry.content:
The form below allows you to create an invoice that you can pass onto your school for the use of NZGrapher. Once you press the "make invoice" button you can download the PDF and send it through to your accounts people to pay... you need to download it and not just send the link. Just sending the link will just send a blank invoice.

Any questions please contact me.

Form not showing below? Click here.

entry.title: Contact
entry.summary: The best way to get in touch is via email. If you want to have a phone conversation, send me an email and we can…
entry.content:
The best way to get in touch is via email. If you want to have a phone conversation, send me an email and we can arrange a time to talk. As I am a teacher I am not always available during the day.

Email: jwills@mathsnz.com

You can also sign up to my termly email newsletter here: http://eepurl.com/4JD3v

entry.title: Donate
entry.summary: Thank you to all the schools and individuals who have supported me so far, your donations have been appreciated and enable me to continue to…
entry.content:
Thank you to all the schools and individuals who have supported me so far, your donations have been appreciated and enable me to continue to pay for the resources I need to develop this site.

If you would like to make a donation, big or small, you can donate using either of the buttons below.

These buttons use PayPal... but even if you don't have a PayPal account you can still use these buttons and use your credit card.

If you need an invoice please click here. Any questions please contact me.

One Off Donation or Custom Monthly AmountÂ 

Monthly DonationÂ

entry.title: NZGrapher Usage
Dataset Info
entry.summary: This is a list of what all the variables are and where the dataset is from for the built in datasets on NZGrapher. You can…
entry.content:
This is a list of what all the variables are and where the dataset is from for the built in datasets on NZGrapher. You can always load your own data, or have a school folder with data that your school has uploaded.

Table of Contents

  • BabiesÂ 
  • Ball WearÂ 
  • CarsÂ 
  • DiamondsÂ 
  • Empty Dataset for EditingÂ 
  • KiwiÂ 
  • MarathonÂ 
  • RugbyÂ 
  • SharksÂ 
  • Sports ScienceÂ 
  • TS NoteÂ 
  • TS - Births and DeathsÂ 
  • TS - ForestryÂ 
  • TS - ImportsÂ 
  • TS - JobsÂ 
  • TS - PenguinÂ 
  • TS - Sea IceÂ 
  • TS - SunglassesÂ 
  • TS â Temperatures AucklandÂ 
  • TS - VisitorsÂ 
  • Temperatures - AucklandÂ 

BabiesÂ 

The data on 189 births were collected at Baystate Medical Center, Springfield, Mass. during 1986. The goal of this study was to identify risk factors associated with giving birth to a low birth weightÂ  baby (weighing less than 2500 grams). Data was collected on 189 women, 59 of which had lowÂ  birth weight babies and 130 of which had normal birth weight babies.

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

LowBirthWeightÂ 

No = Birth Weight >= 2500gÂ 

Yes = Birth Weight < 2500g

MothersAgeÂ 

Age of the Mother in Years

RaceÂ 

Race of the mother

MotherSmokeÂ 

Smoking Status During Pregnancy

FTVÂ 

Number of Physician Visits During the First Trimester

BirthWeightÂ 

Birth Weight in Grams

Â 

Ball WearÂ 

Data was recorded of students going to the school ball in 2012 as to how much they spent onÂ  their clothing and accessories.Â 

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

GenderÂ 

Boy = new student is maleÂ 

Girl = new student is female

Amount.spentÂ 

The amount spent on clothing and accessories in New Zealand Dollars.

Â 

CarsÂ 

With rising costs of owning and running a car, and environmental awareness, buyers areÂ  becoming more conscious of the features when purchasing new cars. The data supplied is forÂ  new vehicles sold in America in 1993.Â 

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

Vehicle Name

 Â 

OriginÂ 

Country of manufactureÂ 

Â· AmericaÂ 

Â· Foreign

PriceÂ 

US $1000

TypeÂ 

Small, midsize, large, compact, sporty, van

CityÂ 

City MPG (miles per gallon by EPA rating)

OpenRoadÂ 

Highway MPG

Drive TrainÂ 

Front Wheel DriveÂ 

Rear Wheel Drive

Engine SizeÂ 

Size in litres

Manual TransmissionÂ 

YesÂ 

No

WeightÂ 

Weight of car in Kg

Â 

DiamondsÂ 

Every diamond is unique, and there are a variety of factors which affect the price of a diamond.Â  Insurance companies in particular are concerned that stones are valued correctly. Data on 236 round diamond stones was collected from a Singapore based retailer of diamondÂ  jewellery, who had the stones valued.

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

CaratÂ 

Weight of diamond stones in carat units 1 carat = 0.2 grams

ColourÂ 

Numerical value given for quality of colour ranging from 1=colourless to 6=nearÂ  colourless

ClarityÂ 

Average = score 1, 2 or 3Â 

Above average = score 4, 5 or 6

LabÂ 

Laboratory that tested & valued the diamondÂ 

1 = laboratory 1Â 

2 = laboratory 2

PriceÂ 

Price in US dollars

Â 

Empty Dataset for EditingÂ 

This is a blank dataset designed for entering experimental data.Â 

Â 

KiwiÂ 

A sample of kiwi birds around New Zealand was collected in order to help with conservationÂ  efforts. The original data is from:http://www.kiwisforkiwi.org/ and was sourced from the secondaryÂ  school guides (http://seniorsecondary.tki.org.nz/Mathematics-and-statistics/Achievement objectives/AOs-by-level/AO-S7-1)Â 

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

SpeciesÂ 

GS-Great SpottedÂ 

NIBr-NorthIsland BrownÂ 

Tok-Southern Tokoeka

GenderÂ 

M-MaleÂ 

F-Female

Weight(kg)Â 

The weight of the kiwi bird in kg

Height(cm)Â 

The height of the kiwi bird in cm

LocationÂ 

NWN-North West NelsonÂ 

SF-South FiordlandÂ 

CW-Central WestlandÂ 

N-NorthlandÂ 

EC-Eastern CanterburyÂ 

E-East North IslandÂ 

StI-Stewart IslandÂ 

W-West North Island

NF-North FiordlandÂ 

Â 

Teachers note: this is a synthesised dataset based on real data. At the time of creating the dataÂ  set there were around 25,000 brown, 17,000 great spotted and 34,500 southern tokoeka. TheseÂ  numbers formed the basis of the data set, but instead of being out of around 76,000 the data setÂ  contains around 700 birds.Â 

The data was generated using the population parameters, including gender, location, height,Â  weight and species in Fathom. The size of the population was so that it was too big to use all theÂ  data (when doing by hand) but not too big that it couldnât be created for students to use as aÂ  âpopulationâ to sample from.Â 

Â 

MarathonÂ 

The data is a sample taken from marathons in NZ.Â 

It is a simple random sample of 200 athletes.

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

MinutesÂ 

How many minutes they completed the marathon in

GenderÂ 

Male (M) or Female (F)

AgeGroupÂ 

Younger (under 40) or older (over 40)

StridelengthCMÂ 

The persons average stride length over the marathon in cm.

Â 

RugbyÂ 

The data is real data and comes from http://www.rugby-sidestep-central.com/Â 

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

CountryÂ 

New Zealand or South Africa

PositionÂ 

Forward or Back

WeightÂ 

The weight of the player in kilograms (kg)

HeightÂ 

The height of the player in metres (m)

Â 

SharksÂ 

The data is real and comes from the MPI centralised observer database:Â Â 

http://www.fish.govt.nz/miÂ 

nz/Research+Services/Research+Database+Documentation/Cod/default.htmÂ 

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

Calendar YearÂ 

Year which the data was recorded in

Fish SexÂ 

The gender of the shark

Total LengthÂ 

The total length of the shark measured in centimetres

Fork LengthÂ 

The fork length of the shark measured in centimetres



Sports ScienceÂ 

The data is real data and comes from http://www.statsci.org/data/oz/ais.html The data set provides information about 102 male athletes and 100 female athletes at theÂ  Australian Institute of Sport.Â 

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

SexÂ 

male or female

SportÂ 

sport played

HtÂ 

height in cm

WtÂ 

weight in kg

LBMÂ 

lean body mass in kg

%BfatÂ 

% body fat

BMIÂ 

body mass index (weight/height2)

RCCÂ 

red blood cell count

WCCÂ 

white blood cell count

HcÂ 

haematocrit

HgÂ 

haemoglobin

FerrÂ 

plasma ferritin concentration

SSFÂ 

sum of skin folds

Teachers note: this is the dataset used in the TKI Exemplar A

Â 

TS NoteÂ 

All datasets prefixed with a TS that are preloaded in NZGrapher are time series datasets, and notÂ  particularly well suited to bivariate or multivariate analysis.Â 

Â 

TS - Births and DeathsÂ 

Data on the number of births and deaths in New Zealand.Â 

The data is sourced from Statistics New Zealand.Â 

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

QuarterÂ 

Quarterly

Male Live BirthsÂ 

Number of males born during the quarter

Female Live BirthsÂ 

Number of females born during the quarter

Male DeathsÂ 

Number of male deaths during the quarter

Female DeathsÂ 

Number of female deaths during the quarter

Â 

TS - ForestryÂ 

The volume of wood removed from different types of forests in New Zealand. The data is sourced from the Ministry for Primary Industries.Â 

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

QuarterÂ 

Quarterly

Natural ForestsÂ 

The volume of wood removed from Natural Forests in millions of m3

Plantation ForestsÂ 

The volume of wood removed from Plantation Forests in millions of m3

Â 

TS - ImportsÂ 

Information on imports to and from New Zealand. The data is sourced from Statistics New Zealand.Â 

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

MonthÂ 

Monthly

TotalAirportsCIFÂ 

Cost, insurance and freight of imported goods in NZ$(000)

TotalParcelPostCIFÂ 

Cost, insurance and freight of imported goods in NZ$(000)

TotalSeaportsCIFÂ 

Cost, insurance and freight of imported goods in NZ$(000)

TotalAirportsWeightÂ 

Weight of imported goods in tonnes

TotalParcelPostWeightÂ 

Weight of imported goods in tonnes

TotalSeaportsWeightÂ 

Weight of imported goods in tonnes

Â 

TS - JobsÂ 

The number of people in employment in New Zealand. The data is sourced from Statistics New Zealand.

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

MonthÂ 

Monthly

Total Filled JobsÂ 

The number of jobs that are filled in millions

NZ PopulationÂ 

The population of New Zealand in millions

Â 

TS - PenguinÂ 

Data on the number of penguins at the Phillip Island Penguin Parade in Australia. This data was created by a teacher on her return from Philip Island and should not be consideredÂ  *real* but is still useful for teaching and learning.Â 

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

MonthÂ 

Monthly

NumberÂ 

The number of penguins in the colony

Â 

TS - Sea IceÂ 

The data is the surface area of sea ice in millions of square kilometres.Â 

The data is sourced from the National Snow and Ice Data Center.Â 

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

TimeÂ 

Monthly

ArcticÂ 

Million Square Kilometres of Ice in the Arctic

AntarcticaÂ 

Million Square Kilometres of Ice in Antarctica

Â 

You can find some more info about the different measurements used to calculate sea ice andÂ  why the numbers in the different versions are different here.Â 

The April 2017 data was sourced from http://www.climate4you.com/SeaIce.htm Others have been shared with me from various people directly from NSIDCÂ 

Â 

TS - SunglassesÂ 

Data on the value of sunglasses sold.Â 

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

QuarterÂ 

Quarterly

SalesÂ 

Amount of sales in thousands of dollars

Â 

TS â Temperatures AucklandÂ 

Temperature data from the weather station at Auckland Airport sourced from NIWA.

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

MonthÂ 

The Month of the Data

TmaxÂ 

Average Maximum Temperature for the Month

TminÂ 

Average Minumum Temperature for the Month

Â 

TS - VisitorsÂ 

The visitorsâ dataset is the number of people entering New Zealand on a Visitor Visa from Australia,Â  China, Japan and the UK.Â 

The data is sourced from Statistics New Zealand.Â 

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

DateÂ 

Quarterly

AustraliaÂ 

Number of visitors in the quarter from Australia

China, People's Republic ofÂ 

Number of visitors in the quarter from China

JapanÂ 

Number of visitors in the quarter from Japan

United KingdomÂ 

Number of visitors in the quarter from the UK

Â 

The updated version April 2020 also includes:Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

Korea, Republic ofÂ 

Number of visitors in the quarter from Korea

GermanyÂ 

Number of visitors in the quarter from Germany

CanadaÂ 

Number of visitors in the quarter from Canada

United States of AmericaÂ 

Number of visitors in the quarter from USA

Total All CountriesÂ 

Total Visitors to New Zealand

Â 

Extra Notes:Â 

Data is derived from a sample of records and hence may contain sample error. Caution shouldÂ  be used when using data with low cell values.Â 

Visitor arrivals are overseas residents arriving in New Zealand for a stay of less than 12 months. For arrival series, the country of residence is the country where a person last lived for 12 months orÂ  more (country of last permanent residence).Â 

For detailed metadata about countries used in International Travel and Migration statistics, see DataInfo+ http://ow.ly/Mm9baÂ 

Â 

Temperatures - AucklandÂ 

Temperature data from the weather station at Auckland Airport sourced from NIWA. Each row isÂ  one day.

Â 

VariableÂ 

Description

MonthÂ 

Month Number (1 = Jan, 2 = Feb, etc.) from which the temperature was collected

DecadeÂ 

Decade from which the temperature was collected

Tmax(C)Â 

Maximum Temperature on the Day

Tmin(C)Â 

Minimum Temperature on the Day

Â
